results.title: All summer in a day
results.creator_credit: Ed Kaplan, Karl Epstein and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Based on a short story by Ray Bradbury, this short film is set on a planet where the sun shines for only a few minutes once every nine years. Margot, a frail loner, wistfully recalls her days on sunny Earth and waits longingly for the rare appearance of the sun. But she pays dearly for her sensitivity when, as a victim of teasing, she is locked in a closet for the duration of the event. The other children, overwhelmed by the sun’s warmth, have forgotten and left her there. By the time they release her it’s too late - the rain has begun to fall. This is a tale of the destructive nature of thoughtlessness and cruelty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ed Kaplan, Karl Epstein and Learning Corporation of America

results.title: All set backstage
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox and Prahran College of Advanced Education
results.brief_description: The name of J.C. Williamson has long been associated with the theatre in Australia. In an early Paul Cox short film, he takes an historical look at J.C. Williamson and some of the famous acts they brought to Australia. Narrated by Lady Viola Tait.

results.title: All our futures
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell and Harold Mantell Inc
results.brief_description: Narrated by Peter Ustinov this film shows the 25 years of service to children by UNICEF. Beginning in 12 European countries where five million children were given food, medicine and clothing during the emergency period after World War II, and then moving - over the years and to many different places - to show its diversified work in many more countries including Africa and Latin America.

results.title: All Of The Lights music video
All my own work (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Shows how new approaches in art education in Victoria can be successfully applied in the classroom. As the new course is child-centred, the film visualises some of the environmental influences that children experience

results.title: All my own work
results.brief_description: An in-service education film for teachers. Aims to show how the new approaches in Art Education can be successfully applied to the classroom. The emphasis is on painting, while the new course is child-centered.

results.title: All lit up
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Joy Batchelor and Gas Council
results.brief_description: An exhilarating presentation of the story of the use of fire for warmth and comfort since the days of the Romans. Shows something of the inherent problems that have persisted until today; with the use of an ingenious yet simple invention, the major difficulties have been solved.

results.title: All in the game (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
All the aspects of development so far considered in this series come together in play. The quality and type of play depend on all three. The way in which individual and group play develops, and the various forms this play takes are examined in this program. Narrated by Hugh David.
